text:
The creators of TikTok released a smartphone for fans of social networks
04 Nov 2019, 10:30 by Daria Gromova
The application can be opened directly from the lock screen.
Bytedance, creator of the popular TikTok video hosting service, in collaboration with Smartisan, introduced its first smartphone. It got the long name Smartisan Jianguo Pro 3 and combines flagship features, an affordable price tag and design for nostalgic for iPhone 5.



The novelty received a 6.39-inch AMOLED display with Full HD + resolution, a top-end Qualcomm Snapdragon 855+ processor and 8 or 12 GB of RAM, depending on version. The battery capacity was 4,000 mAh. The key feature of the new product is quick access to DouYin (Chinese version of TikTok) by swiping up the lock screen.


livemint.com

Given the positioning of the smartphone, it is not surprising that the cameras are also on top. The main one consists of three modules (the main one is at 48 megapixels + wide-angle at 13 megapixels + telephoto at 8 megapixels + 5 megapixel depth sensor). The main camera is 20-megapixel and supports AI functions to improve selfies.



This is not the first time that manufacturers produce devices targeted at users of a particular social network. In 2010, Microsoft released the Kin smartphone, whose start screen provided quick access to Facebook, Twitter, MySpace and Windows Live. In 2013, HTC First came out with a Facebook shell on top of Android.


HTC First (left) and Microsoft Kin One (right)

Smartisan Jianguo Pro 3 is already available in China at a price of 2,899 yuan (‚âà26,100 rubles). It is still unknown whether he will appear on the international market.
